section.title: Introduction
section.para: This describes the 'poll' contribution. It provides functionality to quickly make a poll in MMBase. It supports IP-checking and cookie/session checking.

section.title: Installation
section.para: Placing mmbase-poll.jar in WEB-INF/lib suffices to provide the needed builders, and tags to fully customize your own poll. The component blocks are implementation using JSP so those JSP can be installed too..
Component blocks are only supported in MMBase versions beyond 1.8. The rest of the functionality also works with MMBase 1.8.
An editwizard task definition is available in the directory 'tasks'.

section.title: mm-pol tags
section.para: Using 'tag-files' a few tags are defined by the poll contribution. They are available by the following URL: xmlns:mm-poll="http://www.mmbase.org/tags/mm/poll"

section.title: mm-poll:vote tag
section.para: This tag explores the request, and handles a vote of a user.

section.title: mm-poll:poll tag
section.para: This tag explores whether the client already voted, and then iterates over the possible answers. It has a 'canvote' attribute which is executed if the client can still vote, and the jsp:body is execute if it cannot vote for the poll.
This tag has a required attribute 'poll' to indicate about which poll it handles.

section.title: Component blocks
section.para: A complete poll implementation using the provided builders and tags is available as 'blocks' of the poll 'component'. The components generic admin pages of MMBase will give an overview of those block hence you have installed mmbase-poll.jar.
